review_title: Good Home, Great People, Poor Pay
pros: -management at the home was amazing, kind and caring -chance to form relationships with some wonderful residents -now offer lunch on shift -working with the residents truly changed my outlook on life, they have so many wonderful stories and gems of advice

pros:
The home does a brilliant job of looking after residents. Care staff get a good wage compared to some other homes.

Improvements are being made gradually to offer more benefits to care staff and moving to more modern systems and away from paper.

No major issues to working here.
cons:
There seems to be a very high staff turnaround.

The home is overseen by a board of retired volunteers. I have seen good suggestions made by colleagues which were turned down straightaway because the board wouldn't like it. 

Joining the company takes a very long time due to the references and DBS checks.
